headline: BlackRock Reportedly Plans to Invest in Circle Internet’s Upcoming IPO
summary: BlackRock, Inc. (NYSE:BLK) is reportedly planning to purchase around 10% of the shares offered in Circle Internet Group Inc.’s upcoming IPO, according to sources familiar with the matter. The move highlights the growing intersection between traditional finance and the crypto sector. Circle, the issuer of the USDC stablecoin, along with some of its shareholders, aims […]

headline: BlackRock Said to Plan to Buy Shares in Circle Internet IPO

headline: Global investors launch Europe defence funds to profit from rearmament
summary: LONDON (Reuters) -BlackRock and BNP Paribas have become the latest asset managers to launch exchange-traded funds focused on funnelling cash into Europe's defence industry, with at least nine new funds created in the last seven months.  European governments are ramping up spending on ammunition, tanks and other arms in response to deepening geopolitical tensions and U.S. President Donald Trump's warnings that they should not rely so much on Washington.  This has prompted money managers to tap into growing investor demand to profit from the region's rearmament drive.

headline: FTC, DOJ weigh in on Republican states’ coal antitrust case against ‘Big Three’ asset managers
summary: The federal agencies urged the court to reject BlackRock, Vanguard and State Street’s motion to dismiss the lawsuit brought by Texas AG Ken Paxton and 10 other states.

raw.headline: FTC, DOJ weigh in on Republican states’ coal antitrust case against ‘Big Three’ asset managers

headline: Telegram to Raise $1.5B Through Bond Sale Backed by BlackRock and Citadel: WSJ
summary: The funds will be used to repurchase debt and are convertible into equity if Telegram goes public.

headline: Wall Street’s Rush to Launch Vanguard-Style Funds Draws Warnings
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Exchange-traded funds have amassed trillions of dollars by offering investors greater tax efficiency, liquidity and lower costs than mutual funds. Now, a looming regulatory shift is poised to bring the two vehicles closer together — and threatens to complicate the very features that fueled the ETF boom.Most Read from BloombergNY Wins Order Against US Funding Freeze in Congestion FightThe US Securities and Exchange Commission is expected to approve applications for dual-share-class
